comments: took him for pol economics, which he could of made more interesting. all and all just a midterm and final. he makes participation count a lot which isn\'t great when you have classmates who talk just to talk to get points.

professional, prepared, very receptive to questions; listened attentively to answers and input; enthusiastic and willing to improvise (and compromise) to help class thrive; knows his material and works to deliver it. the topic and readings are made very accessible, probably more than they would otherwise be in lesser hands. He?s a good choice.

One of the best professors in Baruch. It\'s really hard to find good professors at Baruch. But professor Park is simply amazing. He\'s super smart and extremely knowledgeable. You will learn a lot from this class. Exams are fair and his lectures are very interesting.

One of the few professors in Baruch that actually know their stuff. Hes a very smart guy and a great teacher. Answers questions and respects students. The midterm was extremely easy and the final was a little hard. But overall great class
Second class I took with Prof Park because he\'s awesome. Just got my paper back and he actually takes time to write comments. Fairly hard grader but you learn alot in lectures.

Prof. Park is awesome. Super prepared, respects all students opinions and contributions, never rude. If he cant answer a question, he\'ll look it up and email the class about it. Baruch needs more dedicated professors like Park. You can tell he is really passionate about teaching, and does it well. LOADS of reading, hard work but worth it. TAKE HIM
Big thank you for teaching POL 3103

I have to tell you that Pr. Park was the best professor that I had for Fall 2009. He comes to class well prepared, students engage in discussions. The class environment and teaching was well planned and interesting. Pr. Park is really nice, I think most of the Baruch professors should be as Mr. Park :) He shows greater respect to each student!

Good Professor, a lot of reading, about 30-40 pgs per class. But like someone else commented before, he has a Berkeley Phd. so he knows his stuff, and goes out of his way to teach the course in a way that everyone will understand. Helpful during office hrs Take him, one midterm, 3pg paper and final, or midterm, and 10-13pg paper. Good grader too

Good guy not a ball buster, 4 out 5 quizzes count towards your grade, one paper, a midterm, and a final; or one long paper to substitute the paper and the final. HUGE amounts of tedious reading, some more boring than others, specially the more historical stuff. Still, not a difficult course to pass.

Very nice professor. Extremely helpful and want you to make it through the course. Will bombard you with reading material but you can skim through it and be fine. 4 out of 5 quizzes counts towards your grade. You have to do the midterm but you can choose between 3 page essay+final or a 12 page research paper to substitute them both.

Good prof. Phd from Berkeley, so he knows his pol econ. His class is very demanding but he does a great job of presenting the material in a way that you can understand. Take him, be ready to read a lot, but it\'s a good class.
He is not hard, but he requires a lot of reading for his class. He is super helpful and easy, if you ask me. A lot of people I know got A\'s in his class including myself.
